<?xml version="1.0" encoding="iso-8859-1"?><feed xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xml:base="http://www.destructoid.com/" xml:lang="en-us"><id>tag:http://www.destructoid.com/,2016:blog</id><title>destructoid</title><link href="http://www.destructoid.com/?mode=atom" /><link rel="self" href="http://www.destructoid.com/?mode=atom" /><icon>http://bulk2.destructoid.com/ele2/images/destructoid/favicon.ico</icon><updated>2016-05-13T02:00:00Z</updated><entry><id>tag:http://www.destructoid.com/,2016:/post.phtml?pk=361014</id><author><name>Zack Furniss</name><uri>http://www.destructoid.com/blogs/Zack+Furniss</uri></author><title>CHVRCHES wrote a new song for Mirror's Edge Catalyst</title><link href="http://www.destructoid.com/chvrches-wrote-a-new-song-for-mirror-s-edge-catalyst-361014.phtml" /><published>2016-05-13T02:00:00Z</published><updated>2016-05-13T02:00:00Z</updated><content type="html"><p><em>Mirror's Edge Catalyst </em>is&nbsp;<a href="http://www.destructoid.com/mirror-s-edge-catalyst-has-been-delayed-356805.phtml" target="_blank">just under a month away</a>, and I'm starting to get excited. I haven't played it yet (thought <a href="http://www.destructoid.com/mirror-s-edge-catalyst-free-running-versus-errand-running-355316.phtml" target="_blank">Steven has</a>), but even if it ends up disappointing in any way, I'll be happy if it has great music like the first game.</p>
<p>What's that? A new song called "Warning Call" came out for <em>Mirror's Edge </em>today? By one of my favorite bands, CHVRCHES? Yeah, I'll be playing this one. I'm digging the song, calm and minimalist. I do miss the angry Lauren of "The Bones of What You Believe," but this'll do nicely. I like that she's singing from Faith's perspective, too: "<span>Look down on the cold ground /&nbsp;</span><span>No one try to break the fall...<span>You can run for the skyline /&nbsp;</span><span>Your eyes open wide."</span></span></p>
<p>Please be good!</p>
<p><iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/hSRheLrB1uA" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe></p>					<p>
						<img src="http://www.destructoid.com//ul/361014-chvrches.jpg" alt="CHVRCHES wrote a new song for Mirror's Edge Catalyst screenshot" width="620" border="0" />
					</p>
				</content></entry><entry><id>tag:http://www.destructoid.com/,2016:/post.phtml?pk=360935</id><author><name>Jordan Devore</name><uri>http://www.destructoid.com/blogs/Jordan+Devore</uri></author><title>Oddball RPG Knuckle Sandwich has a fitting battle system</title><link href="http://www.destructoid.com/oddball-rpg-knuckle-sandwich-has-a-fitting-battle-system-360935.phtml" /><published>2016-05-12T21:00:00Z</published><updated>2016-05-12T21:00:00Z</updated><content type="html"><p><iframe width="620" height="349" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/gSZpXO1XdvM" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe></p>
<p>We've seen a bit of the walkin', talkin' side of <a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/knuckle-sandwich-is-another-peculiar-rpg-335153.phtml"><em>Knuckle Sandwich</em></a>, but not much of the combat.</p>
<p>Today's video previews the big-nosed role-playing game's battle system, which, at its most basic, will have you timing button presses to a sliding meter. Hit your mark perfectly, and you'll land a critical.</p>
<p>For more advanced moves, there will be eclectic mini-games. You might need to navigate noodly arms through a maze of blocks or bat at a whack-a-mole ghost in a round of pinball.</p>
<p>Good stuff. I watched the trailer twice for those grooving jams. They're on <a target="_blank" href="https://soundcloud.com/ggyymmss/knuckle-sandwich-battle-preview">SoundCloud</a>, also.</p>					<p>
						<img src="http://cdn.destructoid.com//ul/360935-h1.jpg" alt="Oddball RPG Knuckle Sandwich has a fitting battle system screenshot" width="620" border="0" />
					</p>
				</content></entry><entry><id>tag:http://www.destructoid.com/,2016:/post.phtml?pk=360840</id><author><name>Dealzon</name><uri>http://www.destructoid.com/blogs/Dealzon</uri></author><title>Final Fantasy X/X-2 HD Remaster released on Steam, deals up to 40% off</title><link href="http://www.destructoid.com/final-fantasy-x-x-2-hd-remaster-released-on-steam-deals-up-to-40-off-360840.phtml" /><published>2016-05-12T20:00:00Z</published><updated>2016-05-12T20:00:00Z</updated><content type="html"><p>As of this morning, <em>Final Fantasy X/X-2 HD Remaster</em>&nbsp;became available on Steam for PC gamers. Hooray. Square Enix has continued its trend of no fanfare pre-order phase and immediately went into a release-week discount of 20 percent off. But we wouldn't be doing our job if we didn't tell you that there are better deals out there.</p>
<ul>
<li><em><a href="http://www.dealzon.com/buy/final-fantasy-xx-2-hd-remaster?drc=dtoid" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Final Fantasy X/X-2 HD Remaster</a></em> (Steam) &mdash; $17.99 &nbsp;<em>(list price $30)</em></li>
<li>Use code: DEALZON25</li>
</ul>
<p>Green Man Gaming, like all other Square Enix retailers, is also included in the 20 percent instant savings launch discount... but we've been told you can currently use our 25 percent off code on <em>Final Fantasy X/X-2 HD Remaster</em> to <a href="http://www.dealzon.com/deals/final-fantasy-x-x-2-hd-remaster?drc=dtoid:final-fantasy-xx-2-hd-remaster" target="_blank">double dip on savings</a>. This brings the total to only $18, which, if our math is correct, is totally better than $24.</p>
<p><em>Note: our 25% off code expires tomorrow morning. After that, you can use 20% off code DEALZON20 but you'll be paying a wee bit more.</em></p>
<p>The <em>HD Remaster</em> features include:</p>
<ul>
<li>Adjustable resolution and graphic settings</li>
<li>Pick either original or remastered/rearranged BGM (yes)</li>
<li>Auto save, 2x and 4x speed, or auto battle mode</li>
<li>Enemy encounter frequency (increase or turn off)</li>
<li>Hide HUD (for screenshots galore)</li>
</ul>
<p>You can find the full&nbsp;list of features and details <a target="_blank" href="http://steamcommunity.com/games/359870/announcements/detail/840297192194445207">here</a> in the launch notes.</p>
<p><em>Game deals from Dealzon. Sales help support Destructoid.</em></p>					<p>
						<img src="http://www.destructoid.com//ul/360840-ffx-x2-steam-deal.jpg" alt="Final Fantasy X/X-2 HD Remaster released on Steam, deals up to 40% off screenshot" width="620" border="0" />
					</p>
				</content></entry><entry><id>tag:http://www.destructoid.com/,2016:/post.phtml?pk=360879</id><author><name>Jordan Devore</name><uri>http://www.destructoid.com/blogs/Jordan+Devore</uri></author><title>We'll see more of Gran Turismo Sport before E3</title><link href="http://www.destructoid.com/we-ll-see-more-of-gran-turismo-sport-before-e3-360879.phtml" /><published>2016-05-12T19:30:00Z</published><updated>2016-05-12T19:30:00Z</updated><content type="html"><p>It has been about six months since that initial <em><a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/sony-announces-gran-turismo-sport-for-ps4-317745.phtml">Gran Turismo Sport</a> </em>trailer out of Paris Games Week, and we haven't heard a whole heck of a lot about the PlayStation VR-compatibile sim racer since. We're fast approaching E3 (here comes that familiar combination of excitement and dread!), but we won't need to wait until mid-June to get another update on the game. How's next week sound?</p>
<p>Polyphony Digital has a streaming event via <a target="_blank" href="https://www.youtube.com/user/GranTurismoOfficial">YouTube</a> planned for Thursday, May 19 at 10:45am Pacific. If you just want some fresh details and a new trailer for <em>Sport</em>, that'll be up first.</p>
<p>The stream will then switch over to the serious stuff: a pre-season test of the FIA Gran Turismo Championship Cups (the Nations Cup and the Manufacturer Fan Cup), with awards to follow.</p>
<p>So, a teaser for a teaser, essentially. But good to know!</p>
<p><a target="_blank" href="http://blog.us.playstation.com/2016/05/12/new-gran-turismo-sport-footage-debuting-live-may-19/">New Gran Turismo Sport Footage Debuting Live May 19</a> [PlayStation Blog]</p>					<p>
						<img src="http://www.destructoid.com//ul/360879-h1.jpg" alt="We'll see more of Gran Turismo Sport before E3 screenshot" width="620" border="0" />
					</p>
				</content></entry><entry><id>tag:http://www.destructoid.com/,2016:/post.phtml?pk=358566</id><author><name>James Internet Ego</name><uri>http://www.destructoid.com/blogs/James+Internet+Ego</uri></author><title>How philosophy made The Stanley Parable great</title><link href="http://www.destructoid.com/how-philosophy-made-the-stanley-parable-great-358566.phtml" /><published>2016-05-12T19:00:00Z</published><updated>2016-05-12T19:00:00Z</updated><content type="html"><p><sub><em>[I think there's never a bad time to go back and talk about your favorite games, even if they're not exactly topical anymore. That goes double if you put as much thought into it as James Internet Ego has. A great blog that deserves to be seen, even (especially!) if you've almost forgotten about </em>The Stanley Parable<em>. ~ Shade]</em></sub></p>
<p>Do you remember <a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/review-the-stanley-parable-263731.phtml"><em>The Stanley Parable</em></a>, that witty satirical game written and designed by William Pugh and David Wreden? It was great fun back in the day (still is), and remains one of my favourite games. But when I first played it the satire parted my hair as it sailed, cleanly and gracefully, over my head. I was too focused on how it told its jokes, for <em>The Stanley Parable</em>&rsquo;s main mechanic is not walking, but an idea called 'existentialism.'</p>
<p>Among the core concepts of existentialism is this: you are playing a role in life and can change it as soon as you realize that the choice exists. This is how <em>The Stanley Parable</em> works.</p>					<p>
						<img src="http://cdn.destructoid.com//ul/358566-Header.jpg" alt="How philosophy made The Stanley Parable great screenshot" width="620" border="0" />
					</p>
				<a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/how-philosophy-made-the-stanley-parable-great-358566.phtml">Read more...</a></content></entry><entry><id>tag:http://www.destructoid.com/,2016:/post.phtml?pk=360911</id><author><name>Jordan Devore</name><uri>http://www.destructoid.com/blogs/Jordan+Devore</uri></author><title>Overwatch's open beta had a record-breaking 9.7 million players</title><link href="http://www.destructoid.com/overwatch-s-open-beta-had-a-record-breaking-9-7-million-players-360911.phtml" /><published>2016-05-12T18:30:00Z</published><updated>2016-05-12T18:30:00Z</updated><content type="html"><p>Blizzard has announced the player count for the <em>Overwatch</em> open beta and, <em>holy hell</em>, it's 9.7 million people. For comparison, <em>The Division</em>'s beta <a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/division-decimates-destiny-s-record-for-biggest-beta-of-a-new-ip-343790.phtml">brought in</a> 6.4 million players, a record number for a new intellectual property, and <em>Star Wars Battlefront</em>'s beta <a target="_blank" href="http://starwars.ea.com/starwars/battlefront/news/the-biggest-beta-in-ea-history">came in</a> at 9.5 million participants.</p>
<p>As much as I adore<em> Overwatch</em> and think it has a bright future ahead of it given the company's track record, I am surprised by that figure. A few others: open-beta players logged 81 million hours and 37 million matches. We were all desperate for another great team shooter, apparently. The word-of-mouth from the closed beta's months-long run and the televised commercials certainly helped.</p>
<p>The next animated short, "Dragons," is <a target="_blank" href="https://playoverwatch.com/en-us/blog/20122126">primed</a> for May 16 at 10:00am, so we won't have to <a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/hanzo-genji-and-soldier-76-are-up-next-for-overwatch-animated-shorts-360427.phtml">make it to out to a theater</a>. It'll deal with the sibling rivalry between Hanzo and Genji. Have a favorite?</p>					<p>
						<img src="http://cdn.destructoid.com//ul/360911-h1.jpg" alt="Overwatch's open beta had a record-breaking 9.7 million players screenshot" width="620" border="0" />
					</p>
				</content></entry><entry><id>tag:http://www.destructoid.com/,2016:/post.phtml?pk=360921</id><author><name>Steven Hansen</name><uri>http://www.destructoid.com/blogs/Steven+Hansen</uri></author><title>Popped-collar-come-to-life Gronkowski is the Madden 17 cover star</title><link href="http://www.destructoid.com/popped-collar-come-to-life-gronkowski-is-the-madden-17-cover-star-360921.phtml" /><published>2016-05-12T18:00:00Z</published><updated>2016-05-12T18:00:00Z</updated><content type="html"><p><iframe width="1280" height="720" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/vX6BVrWusxQ?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe></p>
<p>Ah, here we are: today we have 1) the first screenshots of <a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/madden-17-is-out-august-23-360160.phtml"><em>Madden 17</em></a>, 2) the <em>Madden 17</em> cover athlete reveal, and 3) the first <em>Madden 17</em> trailer. My bet is that it is not unlike <em>Madden 16</em>, which I <a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/review-madden-16-307755.phtml">reviewed last year</a>.</p>
<p>EA has a <a target="_blank" href="https://www.easports.com/madden-nfl/news/2016/madden-nfl-17-features-overview">blog post</a> praising itself for "making defense fun again" two years ago and for "help[ing] you to dominate the air" last year. This year seems to be EA's most ambitious yet as, "we address all three phases of the game on offense, defense, and special teams." Wow, all three at once this time! It might be worth noting that that claim is preceded with, "in Madden NFL 17 on Xbox One and Playstation 4" -- who knows which features the PS3 and Xbox 360 versions will be missing.</p>					<p>
						<img src="http://cdn.destructoid.com//ul/360921-gronk.jpg" alt="Popped-collar-come-to-life Gronkowski is the Madden 17 cover star screenshot" width="620" border="0" />
					</p>
				<a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/popped-collar-come-to-life-gronkowski-is-the-madden-17-cover-star-360921.phtml">Read more...</a></content></entry><entry><id>tag:http://www.destructoid.com/,2016:/post.phtml?pk=360880</id><author><name>Steven Hansen</name><uri>http://www.destructoid.com/blogs/Steven+Hansen</uri></author><title>Aw crap, both new Lumines are for phones</title><link href="http://www.destructoid.com/aw-crap-both-new-lumines-are-for-phones-360880.phtml" /><published>2016-05-12T17:45:00Z</published><updated>2016-05-12T17:45:00Z</updated><content type="html"><p>I know it's not new that both upcoming <em>Lumines</em> games would be smartphone games, but I'd forgotten, so I'm sad all over.</p>
<p>As Kyle noted <a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/two-new-lumines-games-are-launching-this-year-340145.phtml">a couple months back</a>, "Mobast <a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/new-lumines-heads-to-phones-as-rez-creator-mizuguchi-helms-new-us-studio-286749.phtml">acquired the rights</a> to <em>Lumines</em> and <em><a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/destructoid-review-meteos-wars-116011.phtml">Meteos</a></em> from Q Entertainment last year and announced a partnership with former Q boss Tatsuya Mizuguchi (<em>Rez</em>, <em>Space Channel 5</em>) and his new California-based studio Enhance Games" to make more <em>Lumines</em>. It's kind of like the whole "give up your child, then adopt them" bit from <em>Hail, Caesar!</em>.</p>
<p>Coming Q2 2016 in English and Japanese is <em>Lumines: Puzzle &amp; Music</em>, which is a paid app. It will be followed by the free-to-play <em>Lumines VS</em> in Q4 2016.</p>					<p>
						<img src="http://cdn.destructoid.com//ul/360880-lum.jpg" alt="Aw crap, both new Lumines are for phones screenshot" width="620" border="0" />
					</p>
				<a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/aw-crap-both-new-lumines-are-for-phones-360880.phtml">Read more...</a></content></entry><entry><id>tag:http://www.destructoid.com/,2016:/post.phtml?pk=360794</id><author><name>Chris Carter</name><uri>http://www.destructoid.com/blogs/Chris+Carter</uri></author><title>Gearbox says Battleborn sales are tracking 'just ahead of Borderlands'</title><link href="http://www.destructoid.com/gearbox-says-battleborn-sales-are-tracking-just-ahead-of-borderlands--360794.phtml" /><published>2016-05-12T17:30:00Z</published><updated>2016-05-12T17:30:00Z</updated><content type="html"><p>I didn't dig some of the things <em><a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/review-battleborn-359125.phtml">Battleborn</a></em>&nbsp;ended up doing (particularly the main MOBA angle), but over time, I can see myself enjoying it more -- especially if Gearbox actually <a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/review-battleborn-359125.phtml">keeps up with its planned regular updates</a>.</p>
<p>But some people seem to be digging it, as the developer notes that the game is "tracking just ahead" of the original<i>&nbsp;Borderlands</i>, when you consider its launch sales period. They go on to note that <em>Borderland</em>&nbsp;sold eight million over its lifetime, and they basically expect the same here.</p>
<p>We'll see. <em>Borderlands</em>&nbsp;definitely had that watercooler word-of-mouth effect, like you "had" to at least try it out and play with friends. <em>Battleborn</em>&nbsp;doesn't have quite the same appeal.</p>
<p><a target="_blank" href="http://www.mcvuk.com/news/read/gearbox-is-cautiously-optimistic-about-battleborn-s-sales-potential/0166757">Gearbox is 'cautiously optimistic' about Battleborn's sales potential</a> [MCV]</p>					<p>
						<img src="http://cdn.destructoid.com//ul/360794-BB2.jpg" alt="Gearbox says Battleborn sales are tracking 'just ahead of Borderlands' screenshot" width="620" border="0" />
					</p>
				</content></entry><entry><id>tag:http://www.destructoid.com/,2016:/post.phtml?pk=360902</id><author><name>Steven Hansen</name><uri>http://www.destructoid.com/blogs/Steven+Hansen</uri></author><title>The best starter Pokemon, ranked</title><link href="http://www.destructoid.com/the-best-starter-pokemon-ranked-360902.phtml" /><published>2016-05-12T17:00:00Z</published><updated>2016-05-12T17:00:00Z</updated><content type="html"><p>The upcoming <em>Pokemon Sun</em> and <em>Moon </em>revealed its three starting pocket monsters this week: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/pokemon-sun-moon-launching-november-18-with-new-adorable-starters-360288.phtml">Rowlet, Litten, Popplio</a> (not pictured above), also known as the <a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/welp-i-can-t-look-at-the-new-pokemon-the-same-way-360406.phtml">cast of <em>Garfield</em></a>. I figured it was perfect timing for a definitive, canon ranking of all 21 mainline starters. But the poll service I used only allowed for 20 options, so I omitted Oshawott, a piece of shit garbage Pokemon no one likes anyways. If you feel differently you can go write a blog about it.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Here is a good reference point for <a target="_blank" href="http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Starter_Pok%C3%A9mon">all the starters</a>.</p>
<p>Only the first evolutions are considered in this ironclad ranking of starters (so no votes for Charmander because it turns into Charizard) to give even playing field to the newbies and so we could consider opinions from as many Destructoid staff as possible. As Occams put it, "I know very little about Pokemon in general but I do enjoy ranking fictional beasts." It's a gut-feel system.</p>
<p>These are all the starter Pokemon, from best to worst:</p>					<p>
						<img src="http://cdn.destructoid.com//ul/360902-start.jpg" alt="The best starter Pokemon, ranked screenshot" width="620" border="0" />
					</p>
				<a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/the-best-starter-pokemon-ranked-360902.phtml">Read more...</a></content></entry><entry><id>tag:http://www.destructoid.com/,2016:/post.phtml?pk=360862</id><author><name>Jordan Devore</name><uri>http://www.destructoid.com/blogs/Jordan+Devore</uri></author><title>Capcom will give games 'more time' following Street Fighter V's lacking launch</title><link href="http://www.destructoid.com/capcom-will-give-games-more-time-following-street-fighter-v-s-lacking-launch-360862.phtml" /><published>2016-05-12T16:30:00Z</published><updated>2016-05-12T16:30:00Z</updated><content type="html"><p><em>Street Fighter V</em> <a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/street-fighter-v-sales-fall-short-of-capcom-s-expectation-360051.phtml">came in under expectations</a> with 1.4 million sales. The general consensus seems to be that what was there at launch just wasn't enough -- it needed more time. That's certainly how I felt as a dormant<em></em> fan of the series who never gets too deep into the competitive scene.</p>
<p>Even Capcom has also admitted as much. Speaking to investors, CEO Kenzo Tsujimoto noted that <a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/review-street-fighter-v-340039.phtml"><em>Street Fighter V</em></a> "needed more polish, such as the lack of content and server issues at launch. Accordingly, we feel it's better to give a little more time to development than before, and have made slight adjustments to our portfolio. Profits may take one or two years longer to stack up than initially expected, however we will be firmly strengthening our brands."</p>
<p>A reassuring takeaway, but let's see it in action. Tsujimoto added that, "Regarding our title lineup for the next fiscal year, we plan to have one that is on par with or better than the lineup for this year."</p>
<p><a target="_blank" href="http://www.capcom.co.jp/ir/english/data/pdf/explanation/2015/full/explanation_2015_full_04.pdf">Financial Results Briefing for the Year ended March 31, 2016</a> [Capcom via <a target="_blank" href="http://www.mcvuk.com/news/read/capcom-to-give-titles-more-dev-time-says-street-fighter-v-needed-more-polish/0166795">MCV</a>]</p>					<p>
						<img src="http://cdn.destructoid.com//ul/360862-h1.jpg" alt="Capcom will give games 'more time' following Street Fighter V's lacking launch screenshot" width="620" border="0" />
					</p>
				</content></entry><entry><id>tag:http://www.destructoid.com/,2016:/post.phtml?pk=359690</id><author><name>Josh Tolentino</name><uri>http://www.destructoid.com/blogs/Josh+Tolentino</uri></author><title>I translated the new Persona 5 trailer, so let's analyze it</title><link href="http://www.destructoid.com/i-translated-the-new-persona-5-trailer-so-let-s-analyze-it-359690.phtml" /><published>2016-05-12T16:00:00Z</published><updated>2016-05-12T16:00:00Z</updated><content type="html"><p><a href="http://www.destructoid.com/persona-5-aims-for-human-relations-a-step-above-social-links-344256.phtml" target="_blank"><em>Persona 5</em></a>'s a thing, eh? The game is set for a Japanese release this September, but at the moment, overseas fans are still left in the dark as to when localized versions of the latest in Atlus' hit series will make it to their shores. I can't help with <em>that</em> part (though more word was promised at E3), but I can try to ease the pain a little, by putting the latest trailer in a more accessible form: An English-subtitled form.</p>
<p>Thus, I broke my voluntary <em>Persona 5</em>&nbsp;media blackout, took a listen, and when I stopped seizing up with delight, I marshaled my meager Japanese skills and tried my hand at this whole fan-subbing thing. Have a look at it below, alongside an absurd amount of screenshots I took to highlight some key points from the trailer.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Naturally, folks hoping to head in completely clean will want to opt out, but for those of you who are hot for more <em>Persona 5 </em>details, the water's fine!</p>					<p>
						<img src="http://www.destructoid.com//ul/359690-b38415838b3a5a2a5aa97f50fbbe431a.jpg" alt="I translated the new Persona 5 trailer, so let's analyze it screenshot" width="620" border="0" />
					</p>
				<a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/i-translated-the-new-persona-5-trailer-so-let-s-analyze-it-359690.phtml">Read more...</a></content></entry><entry><id>tag:http://www.destructoid.com/,2016:/post.phtml?pk=360874</id><author><name>Steven Hansen</name><uri>http://www.destructoid.com/blogs/Steven+Hansen</uri></author><title>What's all this then!? Sherlock Holmes: The Devil's Daughter?</title><link href="http://www.destructoid.com/what-s-all-this-then-sherlock-holmes-the-devil-s-daughter--360874.phtml" /><published>2016-05-12T15:45:00Z</published><updated>2016-05-12T15:45:00Z</updated><content type="html"><p><iframe width="1280" height="720" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/pJYBcikP_wc?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe></p>
<p>Kippers for breakfast, Aunt Helga? Is it St. Swithen's Day already? <em>'Tis</em>, replied Aunt Helga.</p>
<p>He claimed he was my father, he did. Poke the monster with a stick. Tuppence a jab. C'mon, queue up lads.</p>
<p>Jolly sodding xmas, Major. Choke on it! <em>Oh, crikey. You gave me a smash on the noggin last year.</em>&nbsp;</p>
<p>You don't have the cobbles.</p>
<p><a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/i-m-liking-the-new-hotter-watson-in-sherlock-homes-the-devil-s-daughter-354310.phtml"><em>Sherlock Holmes: The Devil's Daughter</em></a>, a follow up to <a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/review-sherlock-holmes-crimes-and-punishments-282435.phtml"><em>Crimes and Punishment</em></a>, is coming to PS4, Xbox One, and PC with a slight delay. You can now expect it June 10, rather than May 27.</p>					<p>

				</content></entry><entry><id>tag:http://www.destructoid.com/,2016:/post.phtml?pk=360791</id><author><name>Chris Carter</name><uri>http://www.destructoid.com/blogs/Chris+Carter</uri></author><title>PSA: Go pick up your Shiny Xerneas in Pokemon now</title><link href="http://www.destructoid.com/psa-go-pick-up-your-shiny-xerneas-in-pokemon-now-360791.phtml" /><published>2016-05-12T15:30:00Z</published><updated>2016-05-12T15:30:00Z</updated><content type="html"><p>Nintendo has been running a <strong>ton</strong>&nbsp;of Pok&eacute;mon distribution events this year, and this month, you can pick up a <a href="http://www.destructoid.com/psa-grab-darkrai-today-by-way-of-pokemon-s-mythical-distribution-event-357707.phtml" target="_blank">Darkrai</a> on top of <a href="http://www.destructoid.com/you-can-also-snag-a-shiny-xerneas-and-yveltal-this-month-358871.phtml" target="_blank">shiny legendaries</a> from the covers of&nbsp;<em>X</em>&nbsp;&amp; <em>Y</em>. The time to get a regular ol' Zygarde has passed, but from now until May 17, you can grab a Shiny Xerneas.</p>
<p>It clocks in at level 100, with Geomancy, Moonblast, Aromatherapy, and Focus Blast. To nab it, just select the mystery gift option and the internet subcategory in either <em>X &amp; Y</em>&nbsp;or <em>ORAS</em>. &nbsp;It's North America only at the moment but since Europe just got Zygarde recently it's probably just a matter of days.</p>
<p>Next up is Shiny Yveltal from May 20 to 26. I've been keeping up with all of these so I'm prepared for <em>Sun &amp; Moon</em>!</p>					<p>
						<img src="http://www.destructoid.com//ul/360791-XV.jpg" alt="PSA: Go pick up your Shiny Xerneas in Pokemon now screenshot" width="620" border="0" />
					</p>
				<a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/psa-go-pick-up-your-shiny-xerneas-in-pokemon-now-360791.phtml">Read more...</a></content></entry><entry><id>tag:http://www.destructoid.com/,2016:/post.phtml?pk=360863</id><author><name>Steven Hansen</name><uri>http://www.destructoid.com/blogs/Steven+Hansen</uri></author><title>See footage of the cancelled Star Wars: Outpost</title><link href="http://www.destructoid.com/see-footage-of-the-cancelled-star-wars-outpost-360863.phtml" /><published>2016-05-12T15:00:00Z</published><updated>2016-05-12T15:00:00Z</updated><content type="html"><p><iframe width="1280" height="720" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/KhKKC07clCs?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe></p>
<p>"<em>Outpost</em>" was listed as a blip in the news of several <a href="http://www.destructoid.com/lucasarts-canceled-a-bunch-of-star-wars-projects-262609.phtml" target="_blank">canceled games over at LucasArts</a> ahead of the Disney acquisition. <a href="http://www.destructoid.com/visceral-s-star-wars-has-hints-of-uncharted-and-1313-295036.phtml" target="_blank"><em>Star Wars 1313</em></a> and <em>Battlefront</em>-style shooter <a href="http://www.destructoid.com/see-the-star-wars-game-that-was-cancelled-before-ea-got-the-rights-319183.phtml" target="_blank"><em>Star Wars: First Assault</em></a> were also victims.</p>
<p>Footage from the canned <em>Star Wars: Outpost</em> finally leaked last night. According to <a href="http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2016-05-12-footage-leaks-of-unreleased-star-wars-strategy-game" target="_blank">Eurogamer</a>, it was "about 90 percent" finished when it was cut down. Always seems like a waste. While we first had an idea of it being some kind of <em>Farmville</em> clone, later sources painted a picture of a much more complex strategy game, some kind of mashup of <em>EVE Online</em> and <em>Settlers of Catan</em>.</p>					<p>
						<img src="http://cdn.destructoid.com//ul/360863-outpost.jpg" alt="See footage of the cancelled Star Wars: Outpost screenshot" width="620" border="0" />
					</p>
				</content></entry><entry><id>tag:http://www.destructoid.com/,2016:/post.phtml?pk=360780</id><author><name>Chris Carter</name><uri>http://www.destructoid.com/blogs/Chris+Carter</uri></author><title>King of Fighters XIV's new trailer showcases Japan</title><link href="http://www.destructoid.com/king-of-fighters-xiv-s-new-trailer-showcases-japan-360780.phtml" /><published>2016-05-12T14:30:00Z</published><updated>2016-05-12T14:30:00Z</updated><content type="html"><p><em>King of Fighters XIV</em>, which has seemingly <a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/king-of-fighters-xiv-is-just-as-fast-as-past-games-this-comparison-video-claims-360088.phtml">bounced back into the good graces</a> of fans as time went on, has a new trailer that showcases Kyo, Benimaru, and Daimon, which all hail from, and collectively make up, "Team Japan." <a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/king-of-fighters-xiv-roster-allegedly-leaked-348836.phtml">If the roster leak is true</a> (which matches up here), this game has a massive cast.</p>
<p>By the way, have you ever noticed that as per Benimaru's official biography listing, under his "dislikes" section, it notes "Otaku" (sometimes translated to "nerds")? &nbsp;He's always been one of the most interesting SNK fighters, and that little tidbit is just really funny to me.</p>					<p>
						<img src="http://cdn.destructoid.com//ul/360780-DV1.jpg" alt="King of Fighters XIV's new trailer showcases Japan screenshot" width="620" border="0" />
					</p>
				<a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/king-of-fighters-xiv-s-new-trailer-showcases-japan-360780.phtml">Read more...</a></content></entry><entry><id>tag:http://www.destructoid.com/,2016:/post.phtml?pk=360868</id><author><name>Steven Hansen</name><uri>http://www.destructoid.com/blogs/Steven+Hansen</uri></author><title>Russian embassy warns of chemical warfare with Command & Conquer screen</title><link href="http://www.destructoid.com/russian-embassy-warns-of-chemical-warfare-with-command-conquer-screen-360868.phtml" /><published>2016-05-12T14:15:00Z</published><updated>2016-05-12T14:15:00Z</updated><content type="html"><p>The official account of The Russian Embassy in London <a target="_blank" href="https://twitter.com/RussianEmbassy/status/730701444823826432">tweeted</a> an ostensible news report about, "Extremists near Aleppo received several truckloads of chemical ammo." Aleppo is the largest city in Syria, a country wherein 11.5 percent of the entire population has been wounded or killed since 2011. The <a target="_blank" href="http://www.pbs.org/wgbh/frontline/article/a-staggering-new-death-toll-for-syrias-war-470000/">last reported death toll is 470,000</a>; 400,000 have been killed in violence, while "70,000 [deaths] came as an indirect result&nbsp;of the war."</p>					<p>
						<img src="http://cdn.destructoid.com//ul/360868-puttingonairs.jpg" alt="Russian embassy warns of chemical warfare with Command & Conquer screen screenshot" width="620" border="0" />
					</p>
				<a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/russian-embassy-warns-of-chemical-warfare-with-command-conquer-screen-360868.phtml">Read more...</a></content></entry><entry><id>tag:http://www.destructoid.com/,2016:/post.phtml?pk=360861</id><author><name>Chris Carter</name><uri>http://www.destructoid.com/blogs/Chris+Carter</uri></author><title>Lionhead execs explain how their empire rose and fell</title><link href="http://www.destructoid.com/lionhead-execs-explain-how-their-empire-rose-and-fell-360861.phtml" /><published>2016-05-12T14:00:00Z</published><updated>2016-05-12T14:00:00Z</updated><content type="html"><p>Eurogamer just put up a pretty <a target="_blank" href="http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2016-05-12-lionhead-the-inside-story">in-depth history of Lionhead Studios</a>, and it's a doozy.&nbsp;Most of the info comes by way of John McCormack, art director for the <em>Fable</em> series. There's a lot of interesting tidbits from this tale, most notably how Microsoft saved <em>Fable</em>, but didn't directly influence its development or direction, and we get a sense of exactly how much control Molyneux had over these projects.</p>
<p>McCormack also gives us a glimpse into the company culture of Lionhead, which was disorganized before it was cool, and includes&nbsp;<a target="_blank" href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8_P4wOHbE9o">daredevil canal jumping antics</a>&nbsp;pre-Microsoft 2006 acquisition&nbsp;("Microsoft HR wouldn't have been up for any of that shit," he says).&nbsp;What's most interesting to me is seeing how natural the fit with Microsoft really was though at first, seeing as how they already had a good rapport with <em>Fable</em>&nbsp;-- it certainly doesn't feel like a hostile takeover or anything.</p>
<p>But eventually, the relationship soured a bit. McCormack recalls how "the marketing was shit," for <em>Fable 2</em>, and how the marketing team, which was separately housed, "didn't get it." What was the contention? Lionhead pitched it as a "<em>Monty Python</em>-esque comedy" but it was being marketed as a generic epic RPG.</p>
<p>That contention only worsened with <em>Fable 3</em>, when he recalls a fight over the box art: "They were going, you can't have a black person on the cover, and you can't have a woman. And you want a black woman. And I was like, yes, I do, because it's about be whatever hero you want. No. It's a white guy. That's just the way it is. We know what sells and that's fucking it. Stop the arguing. I was like, fuck you! That was a huge fight."</p>
<p>Things move on from there to <em>Milo &amp; Kate</em>'s cancellation (and how it might have done better in a post-<em>Gone Home</em> world), "Black Monday" (a day in 2012 where a ton of Lionhead vets quit), and how "<em>Fable 4</em>" [<em>Legends</em>] was eventually born and killed (the meeting to inform employees that the studio was closing was evidently sent out at the same time as the press release). <a target="_blank" href="http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2016-05-12-lionhead-the-inside-story">The entire thing</a> is well worth the read if you've played any Bullfrog or Lionhead games in your lifetime, which I would guess is most of you out there.</p>
<p>Out of everything, one statement from an unnamed source stands out in particular: "The biggest stab in the heart though was that for roughly six years the studio had pretty much been tasked to develop games that Microsoft wanted us to make to show off tech. Very few people wanted to make <em>Fable: The Journey</em> and almost nobody wanted to work on <em>Fable Legends</em>." It's also crazy to hear that <a target="_blank" href="http://www.destructoid.com/what-s-that-fable-legends-may-not-be-dead-after-all-353765.phtml">the efforts to revive <em>Fable Legends</em>&nbsp;post-closure</a> were real, and dubbed "Project Phoenix."</p>
<p>I've said it before, but one of the most vivid memories I have of my gaming youth is reading a magazine detailing "Project Ego," which would eventually become <em>Fable</em>, and then actually playing it, realizing that nearly none of the promised features actually made it in. I just wish we could have had the opportunity to see if <em>Fable Legends</em>&nbsp;measured up.</p>
<p><a target="_blank" href="http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2016-05-12-lionhead-the-inside-story">Lionhead: The inside story</a> [Eurogamer]</p>					<p>

					</p>
